summary: Interactive romantic Valentine proposal web page (single-page HTML/CSS/JS) for iPad Chrome: Yes/No prompt with evasive No button; Yes transitions to a celebration state (no meme image / no "MWAAAHH" text); an "Open letter" option displays a provided love letter; remove the "I have something special to ask you" line; prompt line includes "zia" wording; use a classic (non-cursive) font; pink/white theme.
architectural_notes: Implement as a standalone interactive HTML/CSS/JS page intended to run locally in iPad Chrome.
Use a classic, non-cursive font for UI typography.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page romantic Valentine proposal UI that asks: "Will you be my Valentine?" and presents two prominent options: "Yes" and "No", optimized for iPad Chrome (responsive layout, large tap targets, centered card layout).

Implement evasive behavior for the "No" option: when the user attempts to interact with it (pointer hover on desktop, pointer/touch start on iPad), the "No" button moves to a new random position within the visible container so it cannot be clicked.

On "Yes" click, transition the UI to a celebration state that displays a meme image and the exact celebratory text: "YAYYAYYY I KNEW YOU‚ÄôD SAY YES ILOVEYOUSMM" and also includes the meme text "MWAAHH MWAAAHH" as visible on the page.

After "Yes" is selected, show an "Open letter" option/button; when the user clicks it, reveal the full provided letter text exactly as supplied, in a readable scrollable container (or modal) with clear typography.

Apply a consistent romantic theme using a pink and white color scheme across the page (background, card, buttons, typography), with a cohesive Valentine-card visual style and subtle decorative elements (e.g., hearts/paper texture) without adding extra app features.
Add the required generated images to the frontend as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and render them directly from the frontend (do not fetch through the backend).
Update the main question header text on the proposal screen to include ‚Äúzia‚Äù in the same line, so it reads exactly: ‚ÄúWill you be my Valentine zia?‚Äù

Replace the celebration meme image with a new generated image depicting two cute couple cats and including the meme text ‚ÄúMWAAHHH MWAAHHH‚Äù, and update the celebration screen to render this new image asset from `frontend/public/assets/generated`.
Update the visible meme-text line on the celebration screen to use the user‚Äôs spelling with three H‚Äôs, so it reads exactly: ‚ÄúMWAAHHH MWAAHHH üíãüíã‚Äù.

Switch the UI typography to a classic (non-cursive) font across the app by removing usage of the `font-cursive` styling on headings (proposal screen and celebration screen) and the letter modal title, and ensure all visible text renders in a standard non-cursive font style.
Remove the proposal-screen line of text "I have something special to ask you... üíï" so it is no longer displayed anywhere in the question state UI.

Remove all meme content from the celebration screen, including the couple-cats meme image and any visible "MWAAHH/MWAAHHH" meme text, so the celebration state contains no meme image and no "MWAAHH" line.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build single-page romantic Valentine prompt with Yes/No buttons; No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking
After Yes, show "Open letter" option; when clicked, reveal the full provided letter text
Apply romantic pink/white styling and simple layout optimized for running in Chrome on iPad
Switch typography to a classic (non-cursive) font across the page
Remove any meme image/content from the Yes/celebration screen, including the couple-cats kissing "MWAAAHH" meme and visible "MWAAAHH" text
Remove the proposal-screen line/text: "I have something special to ask you"

projectName: Romantic Valentine proposal single-page experience with evasive No button, meme reveal, and openable love letter
